Anthropometry

Classical anthropometric measurements were taken according to standardized procedures by trained medical persons. Body weight of dressed participant was measured with an electronic scale (SECA 813,  Seca Gmbh & Co KG) with a precision of 0.01 kg. The body height was measured by a stadiometer (SECA 216) to the nearest 0.1 cm. The waist and hip were assessed by using an ergonometric circumference measuring tape (SECA 201) to the nearest 0.1cm.   
All the measure are taken on Day 1 (MRI scan day).

	
Items
1. Height_cm	
2. Weight_kg	
3. Waist_cm	
4. Hip_cm
